subject: Automated Testing for Web applications - Any Experiences ?
msgSnippet: While I am not a hardcore Xp practitioner, I have used junit extensively. I have been attempting to find an effective framework that extends junit s capability
messageBody:
While I am not a hardcore Xp practitioner, I have used junit
extensively. I have been attempting to find an effective framework
that extends junit's capability to Web app testing. There are numerous
but in my mind their effectiveness is in question.

Recently I have been trying to create a sample of automated tests for
our enterprise web application running on Oracle 9IAS. The application
is quite complex and uses Javascript extensively.
My purpose is to create a test that mimics the steps in a `Change
Request' or `Defect' . This would be created by the
developer and
executed before and after the bugfix/change. Therefore I needed a java
based framework with which to create the test cases.

Since these test case need to test a web application, I researched and
finally focused on following three options. Note that while there are
bunch of tools/frameworks, I did not find any big winners.

JAKARTA CACTUS  While I have successfully created some tests with
Jakarta Cactus Framework to create server side tests that have access
to HttpSession etc. objects., this does not allow us to mimic a
user's
browser experience.

HTTPUNIT/JWEBUNIT  After spending considerable time with this
framework, I feel it has ways to go before it can be used for complex
Web application testing. One of the primary issue is limited support
for Javascript. Even if I was to bypass that, I found that the time
taken to create an automated test is too long.

TESTMAKER  This is created and recommend by Frank Cohen in his
book
Java Testing and Design. My reservations with this tool is that I did
not get the impression that is was used by enough developers/testers.
It is also promoted as record/playback tool and such tools may work
well for simple scripts, they can cause maintenance issues for large
testing harness.

My question is :

1. Has anyone implemented automated testing harness for their
enterprise web application that has brought significant value to QA of
their software product/system?

2. If so, then what was the tool/framework used ? And would you say
critical success factor is
a) your architecture/methodology of automated testing harness or
b) the tool/framework

3. Is this even feasible exercise? Can automated testing harness be
created to enterprise web applications?

Thank you

- Niraj
Surya Infosys Corp
